text: <@U02F9CXTL> we heard this from the Care team about prototyping tools

"We’ve lightly evaluated <http://proto.io|proto.io>, and think it’s generally fine. We use Flinto more (and that’s what we have licenses for today), which is very similar in terms of UI but has a better client… both seem reasonably fit to prototype large/multi-flows (or an entire app). For more micro-interactions, we have experience with principle and origami. /cc @toddgriff"
we should compare and see if we can use what they're already comfortable with
<!here|@here> let's have standup in copper today (and moving forward)!
<@U026103R3|abby> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/abby/F57JHBR9A/4|Concept Check In #2 - Tech Focus 5/4>

<!here|@here> setting expectations with ET going pretty well - sounds like Sheila probably won't attend the 5/4 tech call and she hasn't brought up any concerns around just having a discussion focused on understanding deliverable expectations and initial feasibility discussions.
I'll leave the Thurs morning internal review on the calendar and we can se if it's needed. Guessing we'll remove it but why not hold it in case.

For those that are new to sketch, definitely learn about Symbols and nested Symbols. If you wanna get real nerdy, this article is really interesting and I put a version of this process to the test with Compass with smashing results. <https://medium.com/ux-power-tools/this-is-without-a-doubt-the-coolest-sketch-technique-youll-see-all-day-ddefa65ea959>

text: <@U0260V1BX> are you collecting these resources on the intranet anywhere?
agreed, symbols are critical to maintainability, as are text styles <https://www.sketchapp.com/learn/documentation/text/text-styles/>
making a page on the intranet - feel free to add to it: <https://uncorkedstudios.atlassian.net/wiki/display/UI/Sketch+App+Resources>

<!here|@here> REMINDER - please fill out your harvest time sheets each week. We were good for a sec but looks like we've dropped off again. This is super important to give me the info I need about whether we're on budget. Thanks thanks :upside_down_face:

<!here|@here> another reminder with a question - Sejal offered to chat with us this week when needed since she won't be here in person. To me it seems we could use as much time as possible to stay head's down, but please let me know if you feel time with Sejal is valuable and when, and I will work with her to get something on the books.
<@U02F9CXTL> Hey Jason, can you please provide your recommendation here for what prototyping tool we should use? Would like to have the opinion so we can discuss if needed post standup tomorrow.

Chatting with Jason and Melissa now, sounds like we're leaning towards <http://proto.io|proto.io> because it is more robust than Flinto, and we'd rather choose the tool that allows for more, versus choosing a simpler tool and finding out down the line that it doesn't have all the functionality we need.
Jackson also mentioned nobody would mind if we used proto, so I think that's what we recommend to the care team. It would be great to mention this in the 5/8 check in.
